cards.name: Wyluli Wolf
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"When one wolf calls, others follow. Who wants to fight creatures that eat scorpions?"
—Maimun al-Wyluli, diary
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Yavimaya Ants
cards.text:
Trample, haste
Cumulative upkeep {G}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
cards.flavor:
"Few natural forces are as devastating as hunger."
—Kaysa, elder druid of the Juniper Order

rulings.text: Paying cumulative upkeep is always optional. If it's not paid, the permanent with cumulative upkeep is sacrificed. Partial payments of the total cumulative upkeep cost can't be made. For example, if a permanent with "cumulative upkeep {1}" has three age counters on it when its cumulative upkeep ability triggers, it gets another age counter and then its controller chooses to either pay {4} or sacrifice the permanent.

cards.originalText:
Trample, haste
Cumulative upkeep {G}{G}

cards.name: Adun Oakenshield
cards.text: {B}{R}{G}, {T}: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
". . . And at his passing, the bodies of the world's great warriors shall rise from their graves and follow him to battle."
—The Anvilonian Grimoire
cards.originalText: {B}{R}{G}, {T}: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Centaur Archer
cards.text: {T}: Centaur Archer deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Centaurs will kill our aesthir if they can; they've always been enemies. Destroy the horse-people on sight."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight
cards.originalText: {T}: Centaur Archer deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.

cards.name: Dakkon Blackblade
cards.text: Dakkon Blackblade's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.
cards.flavor:
"My power is as vast as the plains, my strength is that of mountains. Each wave that crashes upon the shore thunders like blood in my veins."
—Dakkon Blackblade, Memoirs
cards.originalText: Dakkon Blackblade's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.

cards.name: Energy Arc
cards.text: Untap any number of target creatures. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by those creatures this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Relent, and you may transcend your situation."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

rulings.text: Energy Arc can target untapped creatures. The second part of the effect will still affect them.
The number of target creatures may be zero.

cards.originalText: Untap any number of target creatures. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by those creatures this turn.

cards.name: Fire Covenant
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, pay X life.
Fire Covenant deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.

rulings.text: If X is 0, the number of targets must also be 0. If X is greater than 0, the number of targets must be at least 1 and at most X. You must distribute at least 1 damage to each target.
You divide the damage as you cast the spell. You can't redistribute the damage if any of the target creatures becomes illegal before the spell resolves.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Fire Covenant, pay X life.
Fire Covenant deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.

cards.name: Hymn of Rebirth
cards.text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor:
"There will come soft rains, and spring shall be amongst us, a welcome friend."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest
cards.originalText: Put target creature card in a graveyard into play under your control.

cards.name: Jacques le Vert
cards.text: Green creatures you control get +0/+2.
cards.flavor: Abandoning his sword to return to the lush forest of Pendelhaven, Jacques le Vert devoted his life to protecting the creatures of his homeland.

rulings.text: Gives himself +0/+2.

cards.originalText: Green creatures you control get +0/+2.

cards.name: Lim-Dûl's Vault
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. As many times as you choose, you may pay 1 life, put those cards on the bottom of your library in any order, then look at the top five cards of your library. Then shuffle your library and put the last cards you looked at this way on top of it in any order.

rulings.text: In other words: — Step 1: Look at the top five cards of your library. — Step 2: If you like them, proceed to step 3a. If you don't like them, proceed to step 3b. — Step 3a: Shuffle the rest of your library, then put those five cards back on top of your library in the order you want. The spell has finished resolving. — Step 3b: Put those five cards on the bottom of your library in the order you want. Pay 1 life. Return to step 1.
If you pay no life, you shuffle the rest of your library and then put the top five cards back on top in any order.
If you have five or fewer cards in your library, you can pay 1 life as many times as you like, but you'll keep seeing the same cards.

cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of your library. As many times as you choose, you may pay 1 life, put those cards on the bottom of your library, then look at the top five cards of your library. Then shuffle your library and put the last cards you looked at this way on top of it in any order.

cards.name: Lord of Tresserhorn
cards.text:
When Lord of Tresserhorn enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life, you sacrifice two creatures, and target opponent draws two cards.
{B}: Regenerate Lord of Tresserhorn.

rulings.text: When Lord of Tresserhorn enters the battlefield, if you have zero or one other creature on the battlefield, Lord of Tresserhorn itself will be sacrificed as part of its ability's effect. Regeneration won't save it. The rest of the effect still happens.
Since this is a loss of life and not a payment, your life total can be reduced below zero by this.

cards.originalText:
When Lord of Tresserhorn comes into play, you lose 2 life and sacrifice two creatures, and an opponent draws two cards.
{B}: Regenerate Lord of Tresserhorn.

cards.name: Phelddagrif
cards.text:
{G}: Phelddagrif gains trample until end of turn. Target opponent creates a 1/1 green Hippo creature token.
{W}: Phelddagrif gains flying until end of turn. Target opponent gains 2 life.
{U}: Return Phelddagrif to its owner's hand. Target opponent may draw a card.

rulings.text: All three abilities are now targeted.

cards.originalText:
{G}: Phelddagrif gains trample until end of turn. Target opponent puts a 1/1 green Hippo creature token into play.
{W}: Phelddagrif gains flying until end of turn. Target opponent gains 2 life.
{U}: Return Phelddagrif to its owner's hand. Target opponent may draw a card.

cards.name: Ankh of Mishra
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

rulings.text: This triggers on any land entering the battlefield. This includes playing a land or putting a land onto the battlefield using a spell or ability.
It determines the land's controller at the time the ability resolves. If the land leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the land's last controller before it left is used.

cards.originalText: Whenever a land comes into play, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

cards.name: Ashnod's Transmogrant
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Ashnod's Transmogrant: Put a +1/+1 counter on target nonartifact creature. That creature becomes an artifact in addition to its other types.
cards.flavor: Ashnod found few willing to trade their humanity for the power she offered them.

rulings.text: It's the ability, not the counter that makes the creature an artifact. The creature remains an artifact even if the +1/+1 counter is removed.

cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Ashnod's Transmogrant: Put a +1/+1 counter on target nonartifact creature. That creature becomes an artifact in addition to its other types.

cards.name: Clockwork Beast
cards.text:
Clockwork Beast enters the battlefield with seven +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast to be greater than seven. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
This is a change from the most recent wording. Now, if some other spell or ability causes +1/+0 counters to be put on Clockwork Beast, it can wind up with more than seven such counters on it.

If Clockwork Beast has seven or fewer +1/+0 counters on it when its last ability resolves, it can wind up a maximum of seven such counters on it. If it has seven or more +1/+0 counters on it, the ability will have no effect.
Clockwork Beast's last ability resolves, you can choose to put fewer than X +1/+0 counters on it.

cards.originalText:
Clockwork Beast comes into play with seven +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this turn, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast to be greater than seven. Play this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Copper Tablet
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Copper Tablet deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Copper Tablet deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.name: Cursed Rack
cards.text:
As Cursed Rack enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
The chosen player's maximum hand size is four.
cards.flavor: Ashnod invented several torture techniques that could make victims even miles away beg for mercy as if the End had come.

rulings.text: The effect of lowering the maximum hand size makes it so the player discards down to 4 cards (instead of the usual 7) during the cleanup step.

You choose one opposing player just as this card is entering the battlefield and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if this card changes controllers. It becomes useless but stays on the battlefield if the chosen player leaves the game.

If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then a player puts Cursed Rack onto the battlefield choosing you, your maximum hand size will be four. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

cards.originalText:
As Cursed Rack comes into play, choose an opponent.
The chosen player's maximum hand size is four.

cards.name: Dragon Engine
cards.text: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Those who believed the city of Kroog would never fall to Mishra's forces severely underestimated the might of his war machines.
cards.originalText: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Forcefield
cards.text: {1}: The next time an unblocked creature of your choice would deal combat damage to you this turn, prevent all but 1 of that damage.

rulings.text: This can't be used to prevent damage caused by a blocked creature with Trample ability.

cards.originalText: {1}: The next time target unblocked creature would deal combat damage to you this turn, prevent all but 1 of that damage.

cards.name: Ivory Tower
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain X life, where X is the number of cards in your hand minus 4.
cards.flavor: Valuing scholarship above all else, the inhabitants of the Ivory Tower reward those who sacrifice power for knowledge.

rulings.text: If you have four or fewer cards in your hand when Ivory Tower's ability resolves, the ability has no effect.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain X life, where X is the number of cards in your hand minus four.

cards.name: Mirror Universe
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Mirror Universe: Exchange life totals with target opponent. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: When the life totals are exchanged, each player gains or loses the amount of life necessary to equal the other player's previous life total. For example, if player A has 5 life and player B has 3 life before the exchange, player A will lose 2 life and player B will gain 2 life. Replacement effects may modify these gains and losses, and triggered abilities may trigger on them.
If an effect says that a player can't lose life, that player can't exchange life totals with a player who has a lower life total; in that case, the exchange won't happen.

cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Mirror Universe: Exchange life totals with target opponent. Play this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Nevinyrral's Disk
cards.text:
Nevinyrral's Disk enters the battlefield tapped.
{1}, {T}: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.

rulings.text: You don't sacrifice Nevinyrral's Disk to activate its ability. It's destroyed as part of the ability's resolution if it's still on the battlefield. If an effect gives Nevinyrral's Disk indestructible or regenerates it, it stays on the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Nevinyrral's Disk comes into play tapped.
{1}, {T}: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.

cards.name: Onulet
cards.text: When Onulet dies, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: An early inspiration for Urza, Tocasia's onulets contained magical essences that could be cannibalized after they stopped functioning.
cards.originalText: When Onulet is put into a graveyard from play, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Phyrexian War Beast
cards.text: When Phyrexian War Beast leaves the battlefield, sacrifice a land and Phyrexian War Beast deals 1 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
"Knowing its origins, how could they have thought they could control it?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic
cards.originalText: When Phyrexian War Beast leaves play, sacrifice a land and Phyrexian War Beast deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Ring of Ma'rûf
cards.text: {5}, {T}, Exile Ring of Ma'rûf: The next time you would draw a card this turn, instead choose a card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand.

rulings.text: Ring of Ma'rûf works a little differently than the Wishes from others sets. Rather than letting you simply put a card into your hand from outside the game, this ability replaces your next draw. If you wouldn't draw a card during the rest of the turn, the ability won't have any effect.

cards.originalText: {5}, {T}, Remove Ring of Ma'rûf from the game: The next time you would draw a card this turn, instead choose a card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand.

cards.name: Serpent Generator
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Snake artifact creature token. It has "Whenever this creature deals damage to a player, that player gets a poison counter." (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Put a 1/1 Snake artifact creature token into play. This creature has "Whenever this creature deals damage to a player, that player gets a poison counter." (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

cards.name: Shield of the Ages
cards.text: {2}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
cards.flavor:
"This shield is a true rarity: an artifact whose purpose is obvious."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist
cards.originalText: {2}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.

cards.name: Shield Sphere
cards.text:
Defender
Whenever Shield Sphere blocks, put a -0/-1 counter on it.
cards.flavor:
"My soldiers know that they need never fear for their protection."
—King Darien of Kjeldor
cards.originalText:
Defender
Whenever Shield Sphere blocks, put a -0/-1 counter on it.

cards.name: Stone Calendar
cards.text: Spells you cast cost up to {1} less to cast.
cards.flavor: The Pretender Mairsil ordered a great calendar drawn up to show when the paths to the Dark Lands were strongest.

rulings.text: Does not change the mana cost of the spell, it just reduces what you pay for it.
You may choose not to apply Stone Calendar's cost reduction effect.

cards.originalText: Spells you play cost up to {1} less to play.

cards.name: Su-Chi
cards.text: When Su-Chi dies, add {C}{C}{C}{C}.
cards.flavor: Flawed copies of relics from the Thran Empire, the su-chi were inherently unstable but provided useful knowledge for Tocasia's students.

rulings.text: You get the mana whether you want it or not. If you don't spend it, it will disappear at the end of the current step (or phase).

cards.originalText: When Su-Chi is put into a graveyard from play, add {4} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Tawnos's Coffin
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Tawnos's Coffin during your untap step.
{3}, {T}: Exile target creature and all Auras attached to it. Note the number and kind of counters that were on that creature. When Tawnos's Coffin leaves the battlefield or becomes untapped, return that exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control tapped with the noted number and kind of counters on it. If you do, return the other exiled cards to the battlefield under their owner's control attached to that permanent.

rulings.text: The creature returns to the battlefield tapped. It does not return to the battlefield and then tap afterwards.
If the targeted creature is a token, it will cease to exist after being exiled. Any Auras that were attached to it will remain exiled forever.
If the exiled card is returned to the battlefield and, for some reason, it now can't be enchanted by an Aura that was also exiled by Tawnos's Coffin, that Aura will remain exiled.
If Tawnos's Coffin leaves the battlefield before its ability has resolved, it will exile the targeted creature forever, since its delayed triggered ability will never trigger.
Because the new wording doesn't use phasing, the exiled card will suffer from summoning sickness upon its return to the battlefield.
The effect doesn't care what types the card has after it is exiled, only that it have been a creature while on the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Tawnos's Coffin during your untap step.
{3}, {T}: Remove target creature and all Auras attached to it from the game. Note the number and kind of counters that were on that creature. When Tawnos's Coffin leaves play or becomes untapped, return the removed card to play under its owner's control tapped with the noted number and kind of counters on it, and if you do, return the removed Aura cards to play under their owner's control attached to that permanent.

cards.name: Urza's Bauble
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Urza's Bauble: Look at a card at random in target player's hand. You draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Urza's Bauble: Look at a card at random in target player's hand. You draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Urza's Chalice
cards.text: Whenever a player casts an artifact spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: When sorely wounded or tired, Urza would often retreat to the workshops of his apprentices. They were greatly amazed at how much better he looked each time he took a sip of water.

rulings.text: This will not trigger on its own casting. It must be on the battlefield at the time the artifact is cast.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays an artifact spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Walking Wall
cards.text:
Defender
{3}: Walking Wall gets +3/-1 until end of turn and can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor:
"The fortress is not what it seems."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist
cards.originalText:
Defender
{3}: Walking Wall gets +3/-1 until end of turn and can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender. Play this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Winter Orb
cards.text: As long as Winter Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than one land during their untap steps.

rulings.text: All permanents untap during a player's untap step at once. If Winter Orb is tapped as your untap step begins, your lands will all untap.
You can't tap Winter Orb just because you want to. Another ability, such as that of Glare of Subdual, must instruct or allow you to do so.

cards.originalText: As long as Winter Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than one land during their untap steps.

cards.name: Zuran Orb
cards.text: Sacrifice a land: You gain 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"I will go to any length to achieve my goal. Eternal life is worth any sacrifice."
—Zur the Enchanter
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a land: You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Diamond Valley
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.

cards.name: Island of Wak-Wak
cards.text: {T}: Target creature with flying has base power 0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The Isle of Wak-Wak, home to a tribe of winged folk, is named for a peculiar fruit that grows there. The fruit looks like a woman's head, and when ripe speaks the word "Wak."

rulings.text: This is not an Island.
Sets power to 0 instead of giving the creature -X/-0.

You apply power/toughness changing effects in a series of sublayers in the following order: (a) effects from characteristic-defining abilities; (b) effects that set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (c) effects that modify power and/or toughness but don't set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (d) changes from counters; (e) effects that switch a creature's power and toughness. This card's effect is always applied in (b), which means that effects applied in sublayer (c), (d), or (e) will not be overwritten; they will be applied to the new value.

cards.originalText: {T}: The power of target creature with flying becomes 0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Lake of the Dead
cards.text:
If Lake of the Dead would enter the battlefield, sacrifice a Swamp instead. If you do, put Lake of the Dead onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add {B}.
{T}, Sacrifice a Swamp: Add {B}{B}{B}{B}.

rulings.text: The tap and sacrifice counts as tapping the land for mana.
You have to sacrifice a swamp before this card is put onto the battlefield. And you have to do this no matter how it is put onto the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
If Lake of the Dead would come into play, sacrifice a Swamp instead. If you do, put Lake of the Dead into play. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice a Swamp: Add {B}{B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Mishra's Factory
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}: Mishra's Factory becomes a 2/2 Assembly-Worker artifact creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
{T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: If another player takes control of the Factory while it is animated, that player keeps control until the control effect ends. They do not lose control just because the card stops being an Assembly-Worker. Note that Auras which steal cards will go to the graveyard if the permanent they enchant is no longer valid.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.
Once turned into a creature, Mishra's Factory's last ability can target itself. If it's already blocking, this won't remove it from combat.
If you turn Mishra's Factory into a creature but haven't controlled it continuously since your most recent turn began, you won't be able to activate its first or last ability.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}: Mishra's Factory becomes a 2/2 Assembly-Worker artifact creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
{T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Rainbow Vale
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color. An opponent gains control of Rainbow Vale at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: In the feudal days of Icatia, finding the Rainbow Vale was often the goal of knights' quests.

rulings.text: Only changes controller at the end of a turn in which it was tapped for mana. It does not change controller if it is not tapped for mana.
Stays in the same tapped/untapped state it is in when it switches controllers.

If control of Rainbow Vale has somehow changed before the "at end of turn" ability resolves, the player who activated the mana ability (not the current controller of Rainbow Vale) chooses one of their opponents to gain control of it.

If Rainbow Vale's ability is activated during an End step, its "at the beginning of the end step" trigger won't trigger until the End step of the next turn. If its ability is activated again during that turn, its "at the beginning of the end step" ability will trigger twice at the End step of that turn.

If more than one player manages to tap it for mana in a given turn, then two control-change abilities will trigger at end of the turn. These abilities resolve using the standard order for such things, so the active player's triggers are put on the stack first, then the opponents'.
The opponent is chosen when the "at end of turn" triggered ability resolves.

cards.originalText: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. An opponent gains control of Rainbow Vale at end of turn.

cards.name: Thawing Glaciers
cards.text:
Thawing Glaciers enters the battlefield tapped.
{1}, {T}: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library. Return Thawing Glaciers to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next cleanup step.

rulings.text: The land put onto the battlefield does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText:
Thawing Glaciers comes into play tapped.
{1}, {T}: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card into play tapped, then shuffle your library. Thawing Glaciers gains substance until end of turn. Return Thawing Glaciers to its owner's hand when it loses substance.

cards.name: Alaborn Musketeer
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: Muskets gave the Alaborn army an advantage it had long lacked—air defense.
cards.originalText: Reach

cards.name: Alaborn Trooper
cards.flavor:
"I dedicate my body to my country
And my life to my King."
—Alaborn Soldier's Oath

cards.name: Angelic Voices
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 as long as you control no nonartifact, nonwhite creatures.

rulings.text: You get the bonus if all of your creatures are white or artifact even if they also have other colors or qualities. So, if your only creature is a white and green creature, or a red artifact creature, you would get the bonus.

cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +1/+1 as long as you control no nonartifact, nonwhite creatures.

cards.name: Argivian Blacksmith
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target artifact creature this turn.
cards.flavor: Through years of study and training, the Blacksmiths of Argive became adept at reassembling the mangled remains of the strange, mechanical creatures abounding in their native land.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target artifact creature this turn.

cards.name: Armageddon
cards.text: Destroy all lands.
cards.flavor:
"'O miserable of happy! Is this the end
Of this new glorious world . . . ?'"
—John Milton, Paradise Lost
cards.originalText: Destroy all lands.

cards.name: Balance
cards.text: Each player chooses a number of lands they control equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Players discard cards and sacrifice creatures the same way.

rulings.text: First the player whose turn it is chooses which lands (if any) to keep, then each other player in turn order does the same. Each player will know the choices made by the players who chose before them. All of the unchosen lands are then sacrificed simultaneously. Then the process is repeated for cards in hand, except that no cards are revealed until all players have chosen what to discard, at which point those cards are all discarded simultaneously. Lastly, the process is repeated for creatures, and players will again know earlier choices made when deciding what to sacrifice. All of the unchosen creatures are then sacrificed simultaneously.
Balance doesn't have targets, so permanents that can't be targeted, such as a creature with shroud or protection from white, are valid choices to be sacrificed.

Each type of object is counted during the corresponding part of the process. Cards in hand are counted after lands have been sacrificed, and creatures on the battlefield are counted after cards have been discarded. Thus, a land creature sacrificed to the first part of the spell would not be counted when determining how many creatures are on the battlefield for the last part.

cards.originalText: Each player chooses a number of lands he or she controls equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Players discard cards and sacrifice creatures the same way.

cards.name: Blaze of Glory
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during combat before blockers are declared.
Target creature defending player controls can block any number of creatures this turn. It blocks each attacking creature this turn if able.

rulings.text: Does not allow a tapped creature to block, or allow a creature to block any creatures it would not normally be able to block.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can be cast during any of them as long as it's before the beginning of that phase's Declare Blockers Step.

cards.originalText: Target creature can block any number of creatures this turn. It must block each attacking creature this turn if able.

cards.name: Champion Lancer
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Champion Lancer by creatures.
cards.flavor: The flash of his lance projects the pure radiance of his honor.
cards.originalText: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Champion Lancer by creatures.

cards.name: Conversion
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Conversion unless you pay {W}{W}.
All Mountains are Plains.

rulings.text: The Conversion effect is a continuous effect. There is no chance to tap a just-played mountain for red mana before it becomes a plains.
Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Conversion unless you pay {W}{W}.
All Mountains are Plains.

cards.name: Divine Offering
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.

rulings.text: If the target artifact becomes illegal before resolution, you do not gain any life.
If Divine Offering resolves, but the artifact regenerates or has indestructible, you'll still gain the life.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.

cards.name: Dust to Dust
cards.text: Exile two target artifacts.
cards.flavor:
"All this nonsense made by mages Rusts and crumbles through the ages."
—Aline Corralurn, "Inheritance"

rulings.text: If one target is removed or becomes invalid after declaration, the other target is still affected.

cards.originalText: Exile two target artifacts.

cards.name: Eye for an Eye
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, instead that source deals that much damage to you and Eye for an Eye deals that much damage to that source's controller.

rulings.text: The damage dealt to you is still being dealt by the original source. The damage dealt to the other player is being dealt by Eye for an Eye.
Eye for an Eye must resolve before damage would be dealt to you in order to affect that damage.

cards.originalText: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, instead that source deals that much damage to you and Eye for an Eye deals that much damage to that source's controller.

cards.name: Harsh Justice
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
This turn, whenever an attacking creature deals combat damage to you, it deals that much damage to its controller.
cards.originalText:
Cast Harsh Justice only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
This turn, whenever an attacking creature deals combat damage to you, it deals that much damage to its controller.

cards.name: Healing Salve
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.originalText: Choose one — Target player gains 3 life; or prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Island Sanctuary
cards.text: If you would draw a card during your draw step, instead you may skip that draw. If you do, until your next turn, you can't be attacked except by creatures with flying and/or islandwalk.

rulings.text: If you get multiple draws or you use a spell or ability during the draw step to draw extra cards, you can have the replacement effect apply to any one or all of those. You need only have it apply once to get the effect. If you skip more than one, there is no additional effect.
If the replacement effect is applied, the effect will continue until your next turn even if this card leaves the battlefield.
Since the draw is replaced, you can't use the same draw to do other things.

cards.originalText: If you would draw a card during your draw step, instead you may skip that draw. If you do, until your next turn, you can't be attacked except by creatures with flying and/or islandwalk.

cards.name: Just Fate
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Destroy target attacking creature.
cards.originalText:
Cast Just Fate only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Destroy target attacking creature.

cards.name: Kismet
cards.text: Artifacts, creatures, and lands your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor:
"Make people wait for what they want, and you have power over them. This is as true for merchants and militia as it is for cooks and couples."
—Gwendlyn Di Corci

rulings.text: Cards enter the battlefield tapped. They do not enter the battlefield untapped and then immediately tap, therefore they do not trigger any effects due to tapping.
It affects all opponents.
Does not affect cards that phase in.

cards.originalText: Artifacts, creatures, and lands played by your opponents enter the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Leeches
cards.text: Target player loses all poison counters. Leeches deals that much damage to that player.
cards.flavor:
"Where our potions and powders fail, perhaps nature will succeed."
—Reyhan, Samite Alchemist
cards.originalText: Target player loses all poison counters. Leeches deals that much damage to that player.

cards.name: Martyr's Cry
cards.text: Exile all white creatures. For each creature exiled this way, its controller draws a card.
cards.flavor:
"It is only fitting that one such as I should die in pursuit of knowledge."
—Vervamon the Elder

rulings.text: Only affects creatures on the battlefield, not ones in hands or graveyards.

cards.originalText: Exile all white creatures. For each creature exiled this way, its controller draws a card.

cards.name: Martyrs of Korlis
cards.text: As long as Martyrs of Korlis is untapped, all damage that would be dealt to you by artifacts is dealt to Martyrs of Korlis instead.

rulings.text: If you have multiple Martyrs of Korlis, you can decide which one receives the redirected damage each time artifact damage would be dealt to you.

cards.originalText: As long as Martyrs of Korlis is untapped, all damage that would be dealt to you by artifacts is dealt to Martyrs of Korlis instead.

cards.name: Osai Vultures
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of each end step, if a creature died this turn, put a carrion counter on Osai Vultures.
Remove two carrion counters from Osai Vultures: Osai Vultures gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Only gets one counter per turn, not one per creature.

cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of each end step, if a creature was put into a graveyard from the battlefield this turn, put a carrion counter on Osai Vultures.
Remove two carrion counters from Osai Vultures: Osai Vultures gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Personal Incarnation
cards.text:
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Personal Incarnation this turn is dealt to its owner instead. Only Personal Incarnation's owner may activate this ability.
When Personal Incarnation dies, its owner loses half their life, rounded up.

rulings.text: You do not lose life if this card is exiled or sent someplace without going to the graveyard first.
The owner of the Incarnation loses life when it is destroyed, not the controller. So if you control your opponent's Incarnation you can let it die to make them lose life.
If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0. This means that the life total stays the same. A life total of -10 would remain -10.

cards.originalText:
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Personal Incarnation this turn is dealt to its owner instead. Any player may activate this ability, but only if he or she owns Personal Incarnation.
When Personal Incarnation is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, its owner loses half his or her life, rounded up.

cards.name: Righteous Charge
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Bravery shines brightest in a pure soul.

rulings.text: Only creatures you control when Righteous Charge resolves will get +2/+2. Creatures that come under your control later in the turn will not.

cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Savannah Lions
cards.flavor: The traditional kings of the jungle command a healthy respect in other climates as well. Relying mainly on their stealth and speed, Savannah Lions can take a victim by surprise, even in the endless flat plains of their homeland.

cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor: Born with wings of light and a sword of faith, this heavenly incarnation embodies both fury and purity.
cards.originalText: Flying, vigilance

cards.name: Serra Aviary
cards.text: Creatures with flying get +1/+1.
cards.flavor:
"Serra, like Feroz, is long since dead. But remember, Daria: her spirit shall survive so long as the Homelands do."
—Taysir

rulings.text: This has the supertype world. When a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

cards.originalText: Creatures with flying get +1/+1.

cards.name: Serra Bestiary
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Serra Bestiary unless you pay {W}{W}.
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities with {T} in their costs can't be activated.

rulings.text: Does prevent the use of activated mana abilities with {T} in the cost.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Serra Bestiary unless you pay {W}{W}.
Enchanted creature can't attack or block and its activated abilities with {T} in their costs can't be activated.

cards.name: Spotted Griffin
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: When the cat flies and the bird stalks, guard your horses carefully.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Steam Catapult
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
cards.flavor: "You idiots! Turn it around! Turn it around!"

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.originalText: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

cards.name: Swords to Plowshares
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

rulings.text: The amount of life gained is equal to the power of the targeted creature as it last existed on the battlefield.
If the creature's power is negative, its controller doesn't lose or gain life.

cards.originalText: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

cards.name: Temple Acolyte
cards.text: When Temple Acolyte enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: Young, yes. Inexperienced, yes. Weak? Don't count on it.
cards.originalText: When Temple Acolyte enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Veteran Bodyguard
cards.text: As long as Veteran Bodyguard is untapped, all damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures is dealt to Veteran Bodyguard instead.
cards.flavor: Good bodyguards are hard to find, mainly because they don't live long.

rulings.text: If a creature is blocked but Trample damage is still done to a player, this damage can't be redirected to the Bodyguard because the Bodyguard only takes damage from unblocked creatures.
Damage goes to the Bodyguard as long as he is untapped. This works even if he is blocking.
If you have multiple Veteran Bodyguards, you can decide which one receives the redirected damage each time damage would be dealt to you.

cards.originalText: As long as Veteran Bodyguard is untapped, all damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures is dealt to Veteran Bodyguard instead.

cards.name: White Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
cards.flavor: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the knight had just laid waste.
cards.originalText: First strike, protection from black

cards.name: Wild Aesthir
cards.text:
Flying, first strike
{W}{W}: Wild Aesthir gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor:
"High in the Karplusans, death is swift and razor-clawed."
—Arna Kennerüd, skycaptain
cards.originalText:
Flying, first strike
{W}{W}: Wild Aesthir gets +2/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Wild Griffin
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Two little goblins, out in the sun. Down came a griffin, and then there was one.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Acid Rain
cards.text: Destroy all Forests.
cards.originalText: Destroy all Forests.

cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: These spirits of the air are winsome and wild and cannot be truly contained. Only marginally intelligent, they often substitute whimsy for strategy, delighting in mischief and mayhem.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Animate Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
As long as enchanted artifact isn't a creature, it's an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

rulings.text: This card has been returned to its original functionality. If it is enchanting an artifact that's already a creature, it won't change its power and toughness.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText:
Enchant artifact
As long as enchanted artifact isn't a creature, it's an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

cards.name: Blue Elemental Blast
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target red spell.
• Destroy target red permanent.

rulings.text: The decision to counter a spell or destroy a permanent is a decision made on announcement before the target is selected. If the spell is redirected, this mode can't be changed, so only targets of the selected type are valid.

cards.originalText: Choose one — Counter target red spell; or destroy target red permanent.

Flying

You control enchanted creature.
